reviews.review_msg: Shane is a younger prof, and he constantly has little jokes that he throws into the lecture to make it more interesting.  His tutorials are mandatory for the mark. You'll enjoy the material, because he presents it in a fun, interesting way.
best prof ever. very helpful, interesting and truly cares about his students. take his course, you wont regret it!
Huge on multimedia, that's good! Makes lecture exciting even though his voice will lull you to sleep.
Another great prof in the cnms dept.  He was extreamly approachable
Nice guy! He does mark hard and the course load is fairly heavy. Lots of reading, but then what cmns course doesn't require lots of reading?  It's an interesting course though!
New to SFU, he's trying too hard to be a "good" prof. Very organized, yes. His assignments aren't difficult, but his grading is! He expects too much, kinda anal.

Very interesting lectures, good lecture notes that we get to print ahead of classes, well prepared and definitely knows what he's talking about! Is pretty funny when he tries too hard to be funny too~
Fair TA, workload was also not overwhelming. I appreciated that he took time to explain the theoretical concepts. He also helped me a lot with my research paper.

He gives you advice and has a good scope of knowledge. Hes not there to make it like high school and hold your hand. I think he encourages a very open structure tutorial to engage with the readings. Its not hard to find an ad weekly

oh my.. i can never understand what he says.. he doesnt form his sentence/question well. he's also very mean and he likes to 'corner' people with questions.. not a TA that facilitates discussion well for sure. not recommended

Awesome TA.  Got papers back one week after submissive.  Very laid back but very knowledgable.  Second time I've had him as a TA.  Arguably the best TA I've ever had.  If you have the chance to have him as a TA or prof, you won't regret having him.
Idiot. Takes him 7 weeks to return assignments, when he does return something. Spends tutorial watching you tube. Useless, stay away

I was very interested in taking this course. Too bad Brad ruined it with his arrogance and lack of respect towards his students. He used trickery and misleading questions on the final exam, which also included 3 questions regarding Brad's personal life. His instructions are inconsistent throughout the course; he has yet to answer any of my emails.

Before I took his class, the outline stated there was no final exam for this course. Found out that he plans to have one in the three weeks of school. Exam was open book/MC and on canvas. BUT, you only have 45 min to complete 30 MCs! Questions have some mix and match too... it was ridiculously hard...Class Avg came out with a "C"

Easily one of the best professors I've had at SFU. His humor is intelligent, he's down to Earth, very interested in his subject matter and connects to students well. You'll show up to this class simply because how interesting it is. I highly recommend it. I'd be down to have a beer with this guy.

There is only a large term paper and big group project (video), so workload is manageable. Brad knows he's not the most knowledgable or skilled professor, so he tries to teach you practical skills to prepare you in a work situation. I learned a lot in this class, and it was pretty fun and less stress than most cmns classes!
Hes a good prof and will encourage you to relate your own experiences to the course. If you are there to just get a mark you wont get much out of the class.
one of the best profs I've ever had at SFU.

I think Brad thinks he's more awesome than I think he is. That being said, I didn't dislike him, and found a lot of his lectures interesting, but in the end I think the lack of assignments left me wondering what I was supposed to take away from the course. Also, group video projects (with no peer review) in CMNS is BS.

Consider yourself lucky if you get a chance to learn from Brad.  He is very helpful and clear about what he is looking for.  He offers great feedback, and really encourages students to push themselves.  Best experience I have had at SFU hands down.

I didn't find Brad intimidating whatsoever. He was very clear on what he expected of his students and helped them to get where they needed to be. Very helpful and personable. Offered valuable feedback on assignments. Be prepared to offer strong evidence for your arguments. He loves his debates. -MH

I switched my tutorial to be in Brad's.  He can be intimidating but he is not unfair in marking. Explains clearly and expects the same in your papers.  Has very high expectations but will help you get to them by telling you exactly what he is looking for.  Expect to be able to back your arguments with strong reasons in class/papers.

Brad is very knowledgeable of class content, and helped a lot in tutorial when lectures were unbearable. However, he does expect a lot out of his students, and is a fairly hard marker. I found it unfair that he made students in his tutorial do extra work that wasn't required for the course. Overall, good TA, would probably make a better prof.

Brad's lectures are well organized and prepared. Weekly reading may or may not needed for each class, but suggest that you keep up with the reading for the final term paper and take home final.  Brad provides excellent PowerPoint and video clips.  Great class engagement.  He is patience and goes out of his way to assist his students.  Fair marker.

All of you guys who thought that he is not fair or is out to fail you: you are so very wrong and used to profs who don't even read your paper and simply slap a mark on. Brad took hours after class explaining to people (and brainstorming and helping!!) how to make your paper better.

He was awful. Never listened to students requests. Was only a few years older than most of us and thinks he knows EVERYTHING there is to know. Very arrogant. Definitely WILL fail you. I feel bad for the students that had him as a TA.

AGREED! Awful Prof. His teaching is average - maybe interesting to some. BUT the marks he gives out in class is unjustified with no marking criteria - HE WILL FAIL YOU. And arguing with him is senseless because of some arrogant belief that low grades = quality education. Trust me avoid this prof. this is my first ratemyprof comment I HAD tocomplete
Took him in the Spring.  Great guy, very clear and thorough.

HE IS HORRIBLE !! Brad will assign work with little instruction then almost fail EVERYONE for not meeting his requirments. His hand out sheets NEVER have any of the requirments you will loose marks for on your papers. If you try to confront him about this, he talks in circles and basically says you were not paying attention. AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS!
No Comments

Prof was nice, but I thought the class was extremely disorganized, and the lectures were dragged out. TA didn't know what they were doing, and couldn't answer basic questions about the course. I think the prof had higher expectations than what was communicated and should prepare a better rubric for the group project moving forward.

Darren is great! After years as a TA for Jody Baker, he did a wonderful job taking over 323 - despite Covid-19 and remote teaching. always there for students after class, generous with extensions, and explained concepts clearly. However, the course was difficult to distinguish from CMNS 223, and seemed a bit more like a 'beginner' CMNS course.

Jody is an interesting guy who is clearly very passionate about what he teaches and enjoys teaching. He can be a bit rambly and his lectures are confuing to follow because he goes on a lot of tangents, but overall such a great guy. No midterm/final!

Jody is a great prof.  No midterm or final in this class, just tutorial participation, group video project, and term paper (in two drafts).  The lack of exams really took the pressure off and allowed me to enjoy exploring course content.  Jody is awesome and really cares about the topics and his students.  Would take a class with him again!

One of the best. BELIEVE the hype. I've taken courses with a LOT of CMNS professors and man, I have never, ever found anyone who is as down to earth or smart as this one here. Doesn't teach you WHAT to think, just teaches you how. Super nice. I needed an extension due to medical reasons and I cannot tell you how supportive he was. Truly a gem.

Jody is my favorite prof. This was my 3rd class with him. 323 was honestly the best class, there are basically two assignments - a paper and a commercial you have to make and your whole grade is based on the precess and drafts you make throughout the year then the final product. Plus participation! But the lectures were really long. Great class tho
TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT! Always kind to students, always willing to help.
